The Venetian Macao Resort Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 19527 reviews

The suite we had was the best value for money O have experienced in many years. Two major downsides to the holiday experience were 1.

large travel groups yelling loudly amongst themselves and blocking walk areas, being poorly dressed and generally not fitting the generally good standard of the hotel complex. 2. The difficulty in time schedules for the Ferry's from HK airport. If landing at HK International it may be easier taking the train into Hong Kong then the Macau ferry from the HK/ Macau ferry terminal. Check departure and allow over 90 minutes from Landing to soonest ferry departure from the airport if planning the ferry from the airport Sky terminal. Considering all the above, 3 days or so at the Venetian in Macau was still a great and worthwhile experience. Just remember gambling is entertainment. What you spend in the Casino's needs to be budgeted before leaving home.

Show more
Greg , Australia
Studio City Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 2257 reviews

Studio City Hotel is the perfect choice if you are on holiday with kids, but also want to enjoy adult things that a casino can offer.

Studio City is a legitimate resort, with plenty of restaurants, amenities and fun things for the whole family. For kids there is the Batman Dark Flight simulator ride which is the best 4D ride i've ever been on. There's a WB Fun Zone which is a giant kids play area, comprising of multiple floors and can keep kids entertained for hours while you are enjoying the casino. Or can spend time with the kids. The giant pools with water slides, hot jacuzzis and a lazy river cant melt away the afternoon. In the middle of the hotel is the Golden Reel, a built-in ferris wheel attraction. Lots of places to eat. with the only complaint being that room service stops at 10:30pm. The room is very nice. There are two towers, the star tower and the celebrity tower. We stayed in the celebrity tower which seemed to be the less exclusive of the two. But it was easily a 3-4 star room. Has everything, great view and spacious. The hotel can be seen from the airport and is near the Venetian. It's a $50 Macau dollar taxi ride from the hotel to the airport. Overall completely recommend Studio City Hotel for any stay in Macau. You won't have to leave the resort at all unless you want to.

Show more
Martin , United States
Sheraton Grand Macao Hotel, Cotai Central
8.3 Excellent
Based on 15920 reviews

we were a group of 8 people with 4 rooms booked. We waited 1 hour to check-in, which NEVER happened in my life.

we arrived there at 3:30 and finished checking in at 4:30pm. The hotel is too crowded and there are too many people in general. One of our room was not ready and they said the room will be ready at 6pm, which is a total non-sense. We pushed the manager and then we got the room around 4:45pm. They didn't want to compensate anything in the beginning so we asked for the late checkout in case we wanted to leave later the next day. Also, the breakfast buffet and the swimming pool area were too busy as well. I would never go back to that hotel again.. so not worth the money i paid.

Show more
Yi-Seul , South Korea
Galaxy Macau
8.8 Excellent
Based on 9304 reviews

It was our first time to go to Macau together with my family. I was with my daughter that time and I specifically chose the hotel because of the resort.

The lobby was stunning and hotel was so huge that we spent a few hours going around the hotel. It was my birthday a few days before but I was only able to inform the staff when I checked in. I was hoping for a small surprise birthday cake to celebrate the occasion but the staff informed me that we need to inform them ahead of time. Most of the hotels that I've gone to prepares a special something for their guests celebrating their birthday. But overall we enjoyed our stay and we maximize our time at the resort with my wife and daughter. Hopefully I will be able to visit again some time in the future.

Show more
roland , Philippines
Emperor Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 12504 reviews

I wont said all the staff is nice, but there are an older staff which is really nice and give us so much suggestion.

This hotel had the bus service from the jetty (1 hour once) But when i ask in the jetty no one know it. so in the end i paid bus myself i miss the station and i took taxi to reach there again. But once after i reach there then is easier for me to understand how should i travel to place i want. There are bus stop nearby and there are other casino bus nearby for you to reach to those casino you want. Around 20 minutes walk to the Ruins of St. Paul's, or you can easily take bus to there. It take around 8 minutes walk to Lotus Square, then another 7 minutes to fisherman's wharf, then 15minutes to Guan Yin statue, then another 10 minute to walk back to hotel. So location is not bad. Is very near to the jetty. Even if you took taxi should be around 25MOP, cleanliness is depend, is not bad, but I myself had higher expectation. There are no facilities from the hotel. So do not expect much.

Show more
Yee , Malaysia
Hotel Royal Macau
7.9 Very good
Based on 14090 reviews

Our stay in Hotel Royal (9-12 March 2017) was excellent due to the receptionist, she welcomed us very warmly (beautiful smile) at the reception (she is a Filipino and we think her name is May [hope correctly spelt) and staff members in concierge especially Raymond, he is Filipino too).

They were very helpful and friendly. May was extremely helpful as she gave us directions how to move around Macau, where to eat etc etc. Each time when we need assistance, she is always able to answer and extend assistance with a big smile without any sign of irritation! Another compliment are the 2 singers at the coffee lounge, they were very good and we enjoyed their singing entertainment. We like Hotel Royal as its not busy nor noisy with people walking in and out of casinos! Location is excellent to restaurants and touristy spots - all within walking distance! By the way their breakfast was good too. Will definitely stay in Hotel Royal if ever we visit Macau again.

Show more
Ronnie , Australia
Hotel Lisboa
8.3 Excellent
Based on 10114 reviews

Lavishly luxurious and as grand as your grandmother, this hotel is meant to dazzle and impress (and it does)! From the bellboys in neatly pressed and styled uniforms, the huge chandelier hanging in the lobby above the entrance stairway to the carpeted room, you will feel pampered even before you exchange your walking shoes for the complimentary slippers here! There are armchairs in the room, a writing desk, comfortable beds with clean linen and everything that will ensure your stay in Macau is memorable and extravagant.

The restaurants are chic, the location is terrific – about 5 minutes stroll to the famous Senado Square and the adjoining casinos. St. Paul’s ruins are also within walking distance, as are all the fine fusion restaurants and free-tasting bakeries!

Show more
Fang , Singapore
Hotel Okura Macau
8.6 Excellent
Based on 3107 reviews

Suggest you who read this to stay away from this Okura Macau. Lack of hospitality. This Okura Macau ruins the name of Okura group.

Staff not welcoming guests. Non smoking rooms are smelly and not allowed to change even though it's stated on booking "non smoking". One big disappoint that offends me is after I got back a couple of days. There is an email from Okura Macau front officer saying she will charge me $3000 because they found burnt mark on the room carpet. Without talking to me, investigating, showing evidence ... she jumps into conclusion that it's my fault? Sorry I do not smoke. I asked them to change my room since I walked in the first time coz I smelt smoke but they refused and now they blame me for cause of the mark? One tips for you all my friends, if possible when check in, deposit in cash which you will get all back upon check out, otherwise they keep your credit card info and whatever happens, they will just simply charge on the card.

Show more
Chotechuang , Thailand
Sofitel Macau at Ponte 16 Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3715 reviews

We stayed here for a night on 26 to 27 Feb. The hotel does not have shuttle bus from Macau Taipa harbour unlike the other hotels e.

g. Galaxy hotel which I have stayed last year. They do have a mini shuttle bus to Macau ferry harbour but it was always crowded. Hotel is walking distance to St. paul . When we check-in, the staff at reception only briefly tell us our room no', there is no mention about the breakfast timing or the facilities. Hence, we have to keep checking with them. Only good thing will be the breakfast is good with wide variety of pastry, noodles, porridge and the staffs are polite. Swimming pool is not heated so will be cold during cold climate. Overall, I feel that the staffs' customer service at reception can be improved such as giving brief introduction of hotel facilities, breakfast, shuttle bus timing (where to take the bus), facilities so that the customer will feel more welcome. Not just a mention of your room number and that's it. Hotel room interior is fairly modern, well-equipped with bathtub, toiletries and Tv inside bathroom. For the price we paid, we would prefer to go another 5-stars hotel nearby.

Show more
LEE , Singapore
Holiday Inn Macao Cotai Central
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5195 reviews

Guest relations Manager Anthea So took care of my accommodation. From arrival till departure was perfect.

My first time to travel alone. Holiday Inn Cotai Central made it more momorable and fascinating. My room assignment was at the 35th floor And I got a side glimpsed of both Venetian and City of Dreams from my window. The matress and pillows are as comfortable as ever. I had my choice between firm and soft pillows. Both gave me a deep good sleep. The lady who assisted me upon arrival is welcoming. House keeping staff Ronald delivered an excellent service for daytime cleaning and turn down service. The House keeping supervisor even approach me to call her if ever I need assistance. The ambiance of the lounge is relaxing. Judith and Emily were two who delivered very good service giving out information when I asked about the drinks they offered. Thank you Holiday Inn Cotai Central. I'm alone there but staying with made me feel really home. Until my next visit!!!

Show more
John , Philippines
Rio Hotel Macau
7.9 Very good
Based on 2491 reviews

I have previously stayed at this hotel recommended by a friend and I was please I had done so, the services and cleanliness of the rooms was fantastic and highly recommend it.

However this time around I planned to stay there again due to the past positive feedback. However I was quite shocked to see that the bell boys was busy chatting away whilst I was unloading my suitcases from the taxi as well as forcing the door opening solely by myself whilst another bell boy was right next to me. Check in took time and as a single traveller i preferred a double room rather than 2 beds, but the only availability was a smoking room, nevertheless the room could do with some air freshener, the room look more neglected plus no toilet paper at all which obviously I had to call the housekeeping. The doors are never open for you now when you exit or come in, so unsure what the the are standing there for. nevertheless to say standards drop for a 4-5 star hotel.

Show more
ALAN , United Kingdom
Best Western Sun Sun Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 3239 reviews

This is a basic hotel with the standard amenities. The room has an electric kettle, espresso machine, mini ref and a safe.

You can also borrow a handy phone from the front desk which has unlimited data that you can use to navigate the place. The room is spacious enough for my hubby and I and our 1 year old son. I loved the bed and pillows! They're so comfortable and we slept soundly during our stay. We got a room with a bath tub and our son enjoyed playing in the water. Not all rooms have a tub but you can e-mail the hotel before your stay and request for a room with a tub, which is what I did. The location is excellent for exploring the historical center. It's about 10 mins walk to Senado Square. My only complaint is that no one assisted us with our bags when we checked in. That should be automatic for the staff especially since we're traveling with a toddler. But no one even offered to help us. Other than that, this is a good place to stay in Macau.

Show more
Gieliza , Philippines
Grand Lapa Macau Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1815 reviews

Definitely one of my favorite hotels! Got a very good deal, and the staffs are great. We were upgraded to balcony suite on the 18th floor.

Although it's facing the Waldo Casino and not the bay or city, it's still nice. Though the walls are thin, no major distraction occurred since we stayed there on weekends (no ongoing construction). Pools were nice, my 5 y/o nephew and I enjoyed the slide. There are heated, lukewarm and cold (because of the weather there around 20deg C) pools. Many Filipino staffs there willing to help with our itinerary. Free airport shuttle operates in the morning only. Sands Macao is just across so you can just ride their shuttle buses, mind you that Sands doesn't have direct bus to airport so we rode a taxi instead with 75mop bill coming from Grand Lapa, plus ~15mop on top of metered bill for our luggages. Senado Square is also near with only 30mop taxi bill, if you're time conscious. Fisherman's Wharf is nice, just across Grand Lapa and Sands, it's open 24/7.

Show more
Marie , Philippines
City of Dreams - The Countdown Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2732 reviews

The hotel is ok but it was a shock when we had to leave a 200 pound deposit. We woke up Sunday morning to a message on the TV to contact the desk as we had nearly used our deposit.

We had given them our card. They then asked for another 100 pounds. The rooms are ok. It is in a good place but the swimming pool was not open. I think the staff could be a bit bubble like the Hard Rock staff in the Caffè. Food good but you have to ask about hotel discount in the R bar and you have to pay cash to get it. We have been to other Hard rock hotels and staff are all enjoying there job. This was the 2nd time here. STAFF NEED A LOT MOOR TRAINING IN THE Hard rock way.

Show more
lynn , United Kingdom
Broadway Macau Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 925 reviews

First time staying, got an upgrade to a suite room upon arrival with welcome fruits. Spacious bedroom, the extra living room and WC were fantastic! Free mini-bar with cup noodles, liquor, soda, chocolate and chips, that surprised us.

Bed and pillows are comfortable, had good sleep. Love the Broadway Street so much, lots of restaurants and small shops, and even have live band with lovely music till late night. Some restaurants have owl discount, 15% off when dine after 9pm and 30% off when dine after 11pm. That is really cool! Just one downturn, if you aim to use the Galaxy Grand Resort Deck, it is a bit far, 10-15mins by walk. It's a bit too cold returning to hotel after swim walking all the way through the shopping mall.

Show more
HOI , Hong Kong
Banyan Tree Macau
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2308 reviews

We book Banyan Tree Pool Suite King Room because it is the biggest hotel room in Macau and got upgraded to their signature pool suite.

The hotel also provide complimentary cake and wine for our 25th Anniversary which is much appreciated because the other hotel we stay at did nothing for us. The receptionist at the front counter is also very helpful, especially Rebecca and Katrina. The concierge is also very helpful to us, I mention to my wife that I have lost my reading glasses and he immediately offer to call the ferry company and check if they have found my reading glasses. He also provide a lots of venues for our dinning and place of interest... very knowledgeable and helpful ! Too bad, the weather is slight too cool for a swim, otherwise their swimming pool and man made pool would definitely made our stay 110% satisfactory. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Macau.

Show more
Joseph , Australia
Harbourview Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1932 reviews

It is very close to ferry terminal and has shttle bus from hotel to ferry. Every staff is kind and good.

And after check out, I can keep stuff there. It was really needed service. But there is no free shuttle bus to go attractions. I used public buses. The last day, I just asked if I can change macao dollars into HongKong dollars. Cuz I can't use Macao dollars in Hongkong. A staff told me he can help me. So I just followed him. But the staff who was in front of car paking said no. And I explained my situation. But he threw money to me. I can't believe the goodest hotel's staff is rude. You have to train the staff properly. I don't know name. The staff is a man and fat.

Show more
minji , South Korea
The Landmark Macau
7.8 Very good
Based on 875 reviews

The hotel is conveniently located in what can sometimes be a difficult city to navigate, with its confusing one-way street design.

Like the vast majority of larger hotels in Macau, it is in a casino - or the casino is in it - whichever way you want to look at it. Gaming, of course, takes precedence so you need to look for the Pharaoh Palace Casino. Also, like most larger hotels, it does run a convenient shuttle service from the Hong Kong-Macau Ferry terminal. Despite it's supposedly international appearance, gaming in Macau is really set-up for Chinese customers so finding staff with reasonable English skills is sometimes challenging. Check-in here was the same though, in the end, it was reasonably straight forward once two staff members became involved. The room was clean, quiet and typically gaudy. It seemed smaller than advertised but in the end I determined that this was the case because of an unnecessarily large bathroom. But it was comfortable. The "free mini bar" consisted of two cans of beer and two cans of coke. The in-room menu was extremely limited with no western dining options (outside of breakfast). It is the little things that make a hotel stand out from the others and this hotel doesn't have that. Poor quality bathroom amenities and every towel had holes or tears in them. This hotel was comfortable and reasonably priced in Macau terms but I would not rate it as a Five Star.

Show more
Gavin , Australia
Regency Art Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 8285 reviews

In website said they provide shuttle bus from Ferry Terminal and to airport but no Wait for one and half hrs doesnt see any shuttle bus come and feedback to customer service frontliner , blame customer is it did not see clearly the shuttle bus , their reason said their shuttle bus do not have any fixed pick up point and with no good manner.

Two people a room but just provide one mineral water and have a heavy smell in a room plus my friend get bite by tiny insect , i think the bedsheet is not clean Location not really stractegic, you need walk 30minutes only can go Venetian Casino , Wynn and Taipa attraction , go every no shuttle bus and must find your own transportation. Totally bad experience compare to other hotel I stayed in Macau

Show more
Yew , Malaysia
Conrad Macao-Cotai Central
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1417 reviews

Perhaps I have a unique taste from most Asian people, as I am a Canadian Asian, but this is too luxuriously uncomfortable for me.

I travelled with my fiancée to have a weekend getaway, and we were very pleased with the staffs' helpfulness and the room quality, these are two things you can expect from Conrad hotels. However, Conrad hotel was built right between Sheraton and Holiday Inn, so no matter which side your room is facing, you’ll only see the windows of the opposite hotel. The hotel lobby and lounge is directly in between the malls, making it seem less exclusive as gamblers walk by all the time. This hotel is classy, but feels too commercial as it's linked to high-end shopping malls, and somehow they only had Asian (mostly Chinese) foods without a single western one or bars. The location is quite good though, as it is right between the Venetian and City of Dreams, enabling us to enjoy all three areas. Thus, we ended up spending all our nights in City of Dreams, where the SOHO area is a lot more lively with music and good western foods; a lot better than Conrad's classy lounge which for some reason lacks music and atmosphere. Granted, I am the type of person who enjoys Miami beach and chilled night life kind of relaxation. So, if you or your wife loves brand names, wear Prada and Gucci all the time (including your shoes), quiet high tea, and simply don’t like going out much, then this hotel is perfect for you.

Show more
Vincent , Canada
Grandview Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 4222 reviews

We booked two rooms for us and parents. We were well looked after and given rooms next door but one on high floor.

It's clear the hotel prides itself on cleanliness as the rooms were super clean and tidy and bathrooms very inviting. Plenty of staff on front desk to check in and out. Lara was particularly helpful indeed. Thank you for making our short stay v comfortable.

Show more
Christian , United Kingdom
Beverly Plaza Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 4227 reviews

We were exploring the hotel facilities on the 1st night after arrival. We went up to the spa centre. At the lift area it has a long partition.

We read their posters pasted on the partitions. It has pictures of jacuzzi n massage beds. I walked over to the other end of the partition to check out the centre, but was greeted by a rude manager with a loud "hello hello". She barred us from looking inside said fiercely it was meant for men only. I don't understand why a manager can have such a barbarian attitude. It was never stated clearly on their posters that their centre was for men and they didn't even have doors to sealed off their "exclusive" areas. Even the area i saw was all with sofas. Cleaniness : 1 night the bed sheets did not tucked in. the area near the bath tub was wet for 3 days, not bother to clean up. Rooms and corridor area has cigarette/ stale smell. Once my bath robe was wet and put on the floor to change. But when i put on the "new" one, it was wet too. We wonder if it has been changed. Overall the service attitude n experience in macau is really awful. Never return.

Show more
Mei , Singapore
Ole London Hotel

Our stay was ok. We arrived in the hotel past 12 midnight due to our delayed flight. The cab driver did not find the main entrance of the hotel and had to drop us off a couple of small streets away.

More about Macau

Something of the Far East’s Las Vegas, Macau is a small, densely populated region best known for its casinos. The city’s previous occupation by the Portuguese and the Chinese influence has left its mark with an eclectic mix of architecture, Chinese temples, high rises, and 17th century cathedral ruins. Ferries from Hong Kong are a common way to visit the city, but Macau International Airport also provides an easy gate of entry.

The cultural diversity of Macau has promoted a very festive environment, with both Chinese New Year celebrations and The Procession of the Passion of Our Lord held in the month of February. The Ruins of St. Paul’s Church is just one of many historical and cultural sites mixed into the city. Chapels and temples, museums and art galleries, and the iconic casinos of Macau are abundant and beg to be explored. Big name casinos can be found along the Cotai Strip, and many serve as full-service resorts.

For an adrenaline rush away from the tables, Macau Tower has a sky jump and a 233-meter bungee jump – the highest in the world. It also houses a cinema, shops, and a buffet restaurant as well as the best 360-degree views in Macau.

Two major downsides to the holiday experience were 1. large travel groups yelling loudly amongst themselves and blocking walk areas, being poorly dressed and generally not fitting the generally good standard of the hotel complex. 2. The difficulty in time schedules for the Ferry's from HK airport. If landing at HK International it may be easier taking the train into Hong Kong then the Macau ferry from the HK/ Macau ferry terminal. Check departure and allow over 90 minutes from Landing to soonest ferry departure from the airport if planning the ferry from the airport Sky terminal. Considering all the above, 3 days or so at the Venetian in Macau was still a great and worthwhile experience. Just remember gambling is entertainment. What you spend in the Casino's needs to be budgeted before leaving home. Show more Greg , Australia Studio City Hotel 8.8 Excellent Based on 2257 reviews Studio City Hotel is the perfect choice if you are on holiday with kids, but also want to enjoy adult things that a casino can offer. Studio City is a legitimate resort, with plenty of restaurants, amenities and fun things for the whole family. For kids there is the Batman Dark Flight simulator ride which is the best 4D ride i've ever been on. There's a WB Fun Zone which is a giant kids play area, comprising of multiple floors and can keep kids entertained for hours while you are enjoying the casino. Or can spend time with the kids. The giant pools with water slides, hot jacuzzis and a lazy river cant melt away the afternoon. In the middle of the hotel is the Golden Reel, a built-in ferris wheel attraction. Lots of places to eat. with the only complaint being that room service stops at 10:30pm. The room is very nice. There are two towers, the star tower and the celebrity tower. We stayed in the celebrity tower which seemed to be the less exclusive of the two. But it was easily a 3-4 star room. Has everything, great view and spacious. The hotel can be seen from the airport and is near the Venetian. It's a $50 Macau dollar taxi ride from the hotel to the airport. Overall completely recommend Studio City Hotel for any stay in Macau. You won't have to leave the resort at all unless you want to. FHG is the cheapest option and it is obvious -- while the hotel appears nice and the staff was great. The room left much to be desired. I am normally not picky about hotel rooms (as long as I have a bed I am happy) but the room was unnaturally moist -- the blankets, pillows, and sheets all felt wet to the touch, which is an icky feeling. I dealt with it and still had decent sleep but might look for better lodging next time. The price for me was around $90 USD a night. I would pay a $30-50 more to stay at a much better casino resort. Or if money was an issue -- maybe stay at a hostel in Hong Kong and take the ferry to Macau. There are convenient and free shuttle bus casinos offer to take you from ferry to various hotels around macau -- you do not need to be staying at the casino to use. That said, FHG is situated at a great location! The dim sum at this hotel (2nd floor) was also excellent -- but only Chinese menus. Was so delighted to find St Regis in Macau but was so disappointed. (1) the room is smaller than it stated 50 sq. meters something, also the room deco is too dull and nothing special, not worth the room rate (2) The fridge is so stuffed that the guest can hardly find a little room to store his own f & b. (3) There is a limit on the no. of clothes they iron for you, what if it's a couple with a kid, the guest will be charged on additional clothes ironed, never encountered this before. (4) Room service only got Chinese food, all westerners have no choice (5) The staff not so professional that they will still put your visa card transaction in the currency that you didn't opt for even you have checked the box of MOP, maybe it's because all the staff are mainland chinese whose performance are generally much lower than average. I will NEVER ever stay in St Regis again, not the one in NYC nor the forthcoming one in Hong Kong Show more Lai , Hong Kong Four Seasons Hotel Macao 9.1 Exceptional Based on 264 reviews This stay is for celebration of my wife's birthday. Guest relations people welcomed us. After leading us to our room, the check in procedures are carried out comfortably in our room. Not to say the complimentary birthday cake and arrnaging late check out at 3pm. The pools are great and the sauna and spa areas are extremely comfortable and well designed. All staff we come across are brilliant. The are friendly, polite, helpful and thoughtful. This is definitely a great hotel to recommend, if you are willing to pay a bit more(but I am sure that it worths). The room is very spacious. I really like the interior of the room especially the bathroom. The room that we get has a city view which is a not good view - it faces the open parking and pier like area. The room comes with one room for spa/massage which we didn't use. The hotel has free shuttles like every other 5 star hotel. The only problem we had is, the driver(of the free shuttle) cannot speak/understand english. We don't know where is the pick up back to the hotel. It was raining so hard that whole day. We end up walking from cotai back to the hotel all wet, because we wasn't able to catch the free shuttle. We tried their short cable car ride. It was okay. What we really enjoy is the fascinating grand fountain show. I want to try their room accommodation with the fountain view next time :) I still want to stay here next time we visit macau. There was nothing grand about my experience. The pictures are very misleading and appear to be far more attractive than it actually is. Check in is at 3pm...By 3:30 our room was not ready so this was a further wait, only to arrive to a room with a dirty floor, we had to use slippers to prevent the dirt from sticking onto our feet...There was mould around the bath and shower. The "ocean view" balcony was very dirty. The coffee machine was not working. On the second day of staying here...no tea, coffee or water was replenished in the room. We were asked to pay for the coffee, which was to be free. There was no hot water and No hand towels were provided either.The new linen was dirty.The wifi is terrible and of no use. I honestly feel very disappointed and question how this resort has so many positive ratings!!! There are clothes and utensils, etc., all over the corridor Better don't go to Macau, if you have to stay in this place. Agoda must remove this place from their list. Show more Tarun , India Villa Costa 4.5 Review score Based on 44 reviews a very bad "first impression", you call this a villa??? lousy interior design old, everything is old, litteraly everything lady at the desk can only speak Cantonese, she doesn't even speak Mandarin bad power supply, only two power holes and it doesn't function properly located on second floor with no lift, not handicap friendly, staircase quite small bed is extremely DIRTY very noisy place, in the midnight you still hear noises from trucks rolling through the city have spiders as roommates way too expensive for a place so lousy I would never return here, ever sylvia , Taiwan Villa Universal 5.9 Review score Based on 407 reviews The hostel seems a stock room. You walk to your room through the hallway that is full of what seemed to be junks – many defective TVs, many laundry baskets with dirty linens, mops and cleaning materials along the way, and who know what are the others along the hall way. Not a very good view for guests. I booked for single, non-smoking room. I was surprised when I entered the room assigned to me and see a double bed. However, the surprise totally vanished when I saw ash tray on the table. I was staying for just one night so I thought I can take it. But after about 2 hours in the room, my lungs started to complain and I am already coughing. The bed smells cigarette tar and nicotine. I went to the reception to ask to be transferred to non-smoking room. The receptionist cannot understand English. I wrote on a piece of paper but then he said and insisted that is the room I booked. I tried to explain but he kept waving his hand. Good thing, my booking is just for a night. I was frustrated that they cannot understand English. They are not supposed to put their hostel in an international booking site like Agoda if they cannot communicate using international language. I was more frustrated to see the junks along the hall way and most frustrated when I got a smoking room contrary to what I booked. Show more Lumen , Philippines Vila Hou Va Hotel 5.5 Review score Based on 151 reviews Our stay was ok. We arrived in the hotel past 12 midnight due to our delayed flight. The cab driver did not find the main entrance of the hotel and had to drop us off a couple of small streets away. Good we came across a very helpful Filipino who walked us to the hotel and even to the reception, where another Filipina, was working. Our room was already prepared which was good. Our 4-bed room (room #10) was decent, with coffee pot, aircon, tv and fans (one not working though). Shower pressure very good, with hot and cold. Soap, shampoo and toothbrush are also available. No fridge though. Wi-fi access is strong only at reception. Needed to open door a bit to get some connection. Location though is quite good since there is a bus stop just to the left of the hotel entrance..bus 3 and 33 goes to the ferry terminal, which was good since we went on a day trip to HK. Another good thing is the food stall below the hotel who sells fish balls and a lot of other goodies which was very good and open until 2am. The 24 hour mini grocery within 2 minutes from the hotel was also very convenient. We were hoping to get some consideration though for a late check out since we got in very late already on our first night. Unfortunately we were told that we could only extend if we pay 95patacas per hour. Given that, we checked out by 12noon and spent another 8 hours roaming the streets of Macau with our bags before we headed to the airport to catch our 10pm flight. Show more MILDRED , Philippines Pensao Tin Lai Hotel 6.8 Good Based on 196 reviews We had a hard time finding this hotel and when we did, the reception is on the 2nd floor with the long stairs. Good thing they let us checked in early at around 10am so we had time to rest before heading to The Ruins. We were assigned a room at the top floor, 4 floors above the reception. Just imagine when you're dead tired and your still have to climb 4 floors to get to your room. ugh! the worst! The staff doesn't speak english and was a bit rude when we had the toilet door fixed because it automatically locked. The aircon took sometime to cool the room and the control was in chinese. Comfortable beds. Overall, we don't recommend this hotel. Just pay a little more for a modest hotel in macau. This doesn't deserve the 6.7 rating. I'd give it a 2 or 3. of Macau It's easy to get around on foot, and by bus as well. You can discover many culture and traditional food around the old areas, which is very good. The buildings are all very beautiful. Show more Lam ,Macau Macau is a fun place to visit. Experience the culture by visiting the Portugese areas and then visit the modern and exciting City of Dreams and the other Hotels and Casinos in that area. The shows are a must-see too. A couple can wonder around the cities many old, conservatively preserved heritage sites, gardens, temples and markets, as well as live it up in the lively night entertainment dpots and casinos. Plenty of shopping too. Great spot to just spent time with love ones. Show more Quah ,Malaysia As I am a traveler from HK, I found nothing special in Macau. A miniature of HK. But once you are in a hotel casino, there are FREE shuttle buses available directly to other prominent hotel casinos or to the ferry terminal. Or in some case, just take a taxi, won't be expensive becoz Macau is small Ka Yeung ,Hong Kong Discover the neighborhoods of Macau Macau City 84 hotels Cotai 24 hotels Taipa 14 hotels Coloane 4 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Guest Houses in Macau 6 Hostels in Macau 3 Resorts in Macau 2 More about Macau Something of the Far East’s Las Vegas, Macau is a small, densely populated region best known for its casinos. The city’s previous occupation by the Portuguese and the Chinese influence has left its mark with an eclectic mix of architecture, Chinese temples, high rises, and 17th century cathedral ruins. Ferries from Hong Kong are a common way to visit the city, but Macau International Airport also provides an easy gate of entry. The cultural diversity of Macau has promoted a very festive environment, with both Chinese New Year celebrations and The Procession of the Passion of Our Lord held in the month of February. The Ruins of St. Paul’s Church is just one of many historical and cultural sites mixed into the city. Chapels and temples, museums and art galleries, and the iconic casinos of Macau are abundant and beg to be explored. Big name casinos can be found along the Cotai Strip, and many serve as full-service resorts. For an adrenaline rush away from the tables, Macau Tower has a sky jump and a 233-meter bungee jump – the highest in the world. It also houses a cinema, shops, and a buffet restaurant as well as the best 360-degree views in Macau.
